awd_titl_txt: Regulation of Source Leaf Carbon Allocation to Export and   Storage
awd_abstract_narration: Leaves alternate between periods of gradually changing rates of                 photosynthesis and of dark metabolism under the natural daily cycle of          light, yet provide a steady supply of sucrose which sustains                    uninterrupted development of growing parts of the plant.  To do this,           leaves must use stored carbohydrate during periods of low light and             export and store carbon during periods of increased rates of                    photosynthesis.  Regulation of leaf carbohydrate metabolism and export          from leaves provides the means to meet these demands.  This research            project will study key processes by which leaves maintain this steady           supply of sucrose for export.  Regulation of carbon supply is                   particularly important for maintaining balanced functioning of plants           in the face of rising atmospheric CO2 and altered balance between               carbon supply and use that may result from genetic manipulation of              plants.
